Hello blank fragment Main Tab 1 Tab 2 SEACH STUDY PATIENTS GENERAL HTTP DICOM NETWORK ADVANCED Name of server: Settings
Messages Sync
Your signature Default reply action
Sync email periodically Download incoming attachments Automatically download attachments for incoming emails
Only download attachments when manually requested The logical name of this instance of Orthanc. This one is displayed in Orthanc Explorer and at the URI \"/system\" Server name Storage Directory Path to the directory that holds the heavyweight files (i.e. the raw DICOM instances). Backslashes must be either escaped by doubling them, or replaced by forward slashes "/" Index Directory Path to the directory that holds the SQLite index (if unset, the value of StorageDirectory is used). This index could be stored a RAM-drive or a SSD device for performance reasons Storage Compression Enable the transparent compression of the DICOM instances Maximum Storage Size Maximum size of the storage in MB (a value of "0" indicates no limit on the storage size) Maximum Patient Count Maximum number of patients that can be stored at a given time in the storage (a value of \"0\" indicates no limit on the number of patients) Concurrent Jobs Maximum number of processing jobs that are simultaneously running at any given time. A value of \"0\" indicates to use all the available CPU logical cores. To emulate Orthanc <= 1.3.2, set this value to \"1\". Configuration of the HTTP server HTTP Server Enabled> Enable the HTTP server. If this parameter is set to "false", Orthanc acts as a pure DICOM server. The REST API and Orthanc Explorer will not be available HTTP Port HTTP port for the REST services and for the GUI HTTP Describe Errors When the following option is \"true\", if an error is encountered while calling the REST API, a JSON message describing the error is put in the HTTP answer. This feature can be disabled if the HTTP client does not properly handles such answers HttpCompressionEnabled Enable HTTP compression to improve network bandwidth utilization, at the expense of more computations on the server. Orthanc supports the \"gzip\" and \"deflate\" HTTP encodings Configuration of the DICOM server DICOM Server Enabled Enable the DICOM server. If this parameter is set to "false", Orthanc acts as a pure REST server. It will not be possible to receive files or to do query/retrieve through the DICOM protocol. DICOM AET The DICOM Application Entity Title DICOM Check Called Aet Check whether the called AET corresponds to the AET of Orthanc during an incoming DICOM SCU request DICOM Port DICOM Port Default Encoding The default encoding that is assumed for DICOM files without \"SpecificCharacterSet\" DICOM tag, and that is used when answering C-Find requests (including worklists). The allowed values are \"Ascii\", \"Utf8\", \"Latin1\", \"Latin2\", \"Latin3\", \"Latin4\", \"Latin5\", \"Cyrillic\", \"Windows1251\", \"Arabic\", \"Greek\", \"Hebrew\", \"Thai\", \"Japanese\", and \"Chinese\" Deflated Transfer The transfer syntaxe The transfer syntaxes that are accepted by Orthanc C-Store SCP Jpeg Transfer "Jpeg2000 Transfer " Jpeg Lossless Transfer Jpip Transfer Mpeg2 Transfer Rle Transfer Unknown Sop Class Accepted Whether Orthanc accepts to act as C-Store SCP for unknown storage SOP classes (aka. \"promiscuous mode\") DICOM Scp Timeout Set the timeout (in seconds) after which the DICOM associations are closed by the Orthanc SCP (server) if no further DIMSE command is received from the SCU (client) Security-related options for the HTTP server Registered Users The list of the registered users. Because Orthanc uses HTTP Basic Authentication, the passwords are stored as plain text Whether remote hosts can connect to the HTTP server Remote Access Allowed Whether or not SSL is enabled SSL Enabled SSL Certificate Path to the SSL certificate in the PEM format (meaningful only if SSL is enabled) Authentication Enabled Whether or not the password protection is enabled Network topology DICOM Modalities In Database Whether to store the DICOM modalities in the Orthanc database instead of in this configuration file (new in Orthanc 1.5.0) DICOM Always Allow Echo Whether the Orthanc SCP allows incoming C-Echo requests, even from SCU modalities it does not know about (i.e. that are not listed in the \"DicomModalities\" option above). Orthanc 1.3.0 is the only version to behave as if this argument was set to \"false\" DICOM Always Allow Store Whether the Orthanc SCP allows incoming C-Store requests, even from SCU modalities it does not know about (i.e. that are not listed in the \"DicomModalities\" option above) DICOM Check Modality Host Whether Orthanc checks the IP/hostname address of the remote modality initiating a DICOM connection (as listed in the \"DicomModalities\" option above). If this option is set to \"false\", Orthanc only checks the AET of the remote modality DICOM Scu Timeout The timeout (in seconds) after which the DICOM associations are considered as closed by the Orthanc SCU (client) if the remote DICOM SCP (server) does not answer Orthanc Peers In Database Whether to store the Orthanc peers in the Orthanc database instead of in this configuration file (new in Orthanc 1.5.0) HTTP Proxy Parameters of the HTTP proxy to be used by Orthanc. If set to the empty string, no HTTP proxy is used. For instance: \"HttpProxy\" : \"192.168.0.1:3128\" \"HttpProxy\" : \"proxyUser:proxyPassword@192.168.0.1:3128\" HTTP Verbose If set to \"true\", debug messages from libcurl will be issued whenever Orthanc makes an outgoing HTTP request. This is notably useful to debug HTTPS-related problems HTTP Timeout Set the timeout for HTTP requests issued by Orthanc (in seconds) HTTPS Verify Peers Enable the verification of the peers during HTTPS requests. This option must be set to \"false\" if using self-signed certificates. Pay attention that setting this option to \"false\" results in security risks! Reference: http://curl.haxx.se/docs/sslcerts.html HTTPS CA Certificates Enable the verification of the peers during HTTPS requests. This option must be set to \"false\" if using self-signed certificates. Pay attention that setting this option to \"false\" results in security risks! Reference: http://curl.haxx.se/docs/sslcerts.html Advanced options Stable Age Number of seconds without receiving any instance before a patient, a study or a series is considered as stable StrictAetComparison By default, Orthanc compares AET (Application Entity Titles) in a case-insensitive way. Setting this option to \"true\" will enable case-sensitive matching Store MD5 For Attachments When the following option is \"true\", the MD5 of the DICOM files will be computed and stored in the Orthanc database. This information can be used to detect disk corruption, at the price of a small performance overhead Limit Find Results The maximum number of results for a single C-FIND request at the Patient, Study or Series level. Setting this option to \"0\" means no limit Limit Find Instances The maximum number of results for a single C-FIND request at the Instance level. Setting this option to \"0\" means no limit Limit Jobs The maximum number of active jobs in the Orthanc scheduler. When this limit is reached, the addition of new jobs is blocked until some job finishes Log Exported Resources If this option is set to \"true\" (default behavior until Orthanc 1.3.2), Orthanc will log the resources that are exported to other DICOM modalities or Orthanc peers, inside the URI \"/exports\". Setting this option to \"false\" is useful to prevent the index to grow indefinitely in auto-routing tasks (this is the default behavior since Orthanc 1.4.0) Keep Alive Enable or disable HTTP Keep-Alive (deprecated). Set this option to \"true\" only in the case of high HTTP loads Store Dicom If this option is set to \"false\", Orthanc will run in index-only mode. The DICOM files will not be stored on the drive. Note that this option might prevent the upgrade to newer versions of Orthanc Dicom Association Close Delay DICOM associations initiated by Lua scripts are kept open as long as new DICOM commands are issued. This option sets the number of seconds of inactivity to wait before automatically closing a DICOM association used by Lua. If set to 0, the connection is closed immediately Query Retrieve Size Maximum number of query/retrieve DICOM requests that are maintained by Orthanc. The least recently used requests get deleted as new requests are issued Case Sensitive PN When handling a C-Find SCP request, setting this flag to \"true\" will enable case-sensitive match for PN value representation (such as PatientName). By default, the search is case-insensitive, which does not follow the DICOM standard Allow Find Sop Classes In Study If set to \"true\", Orthanc will still handle \"SOP Classes in Study\" (0008,0062) in C-FIND requests, even if the \"SOP Class UID\" metadata is not available in the database (which is the case if the DB was previously used by Orthanc <= 1.1.0). This option is turned off by default, as it requires intensive accesses to the hard drive Load Private Dictionary If set to \"false\", Orthanc will not load its default dictionary of private tags. This might be necessary if you cannot import a DICOM file encoded using the Implicit VR Endian transfer syntax, and containing private tags: Such an import error might stem from a bad dictionary. You can still list your private tags of interest in the \"Dictionary\" configuration option below Locale Locale to be used by Orthanc. Currently, only used if comparing strings in a case-insensitive way. It should be safe to keep this value undefined, which lets Orthanc autodetect the suitable locale Synchronous C Move Whether to run DICOM C-Move operations synchronously. If set to \"false\" (the default), each incoming C-Move request results in creating a new background job. Up to Orthanc 1.3.2, the implicit behavior was to use synchronous C-Move. Between Orthanc 1.4.0 and 1.4.2, the default behavior was set to asynchronous C-Move. Since Orthanc 1.5.0, the default behavior is synchronous C-Move (backward compatibility with Orthanc <= 1.3.2) Jobs History Size Maximum number of completed jobs that are kept in memory. A processing job is considered as complete once it is tagged as \"Success\" or \"Failure\". Since Orthanc 1.5.0, a value of \"0\" indicates to keep no job in memory (i.e. jobs are removed from the history as soon as they are completed) Overwrite Instances Specifies how Orthanc reacts when it receives a DICOM instance whose SOPInstanceUID is already stored. If set to \"true\", the new instance replaces the old one. If set to \"false\", the new instance is discarded and the old one is kept. Up to Orthanc 1.4.1, the implicit behavior corresponded to \"false\" Media Archive Size Maximum number of ZIP/media archives that are maintained by Orthanc, as a response to the asynchronous creation of archives. The least recently used archives get deleted as new archives are generated. This option was introduced in Orthanc 1.5.0, and has no effect on the synchronous generation of archives OrthancPeers OrthancPeers Name IP adress PORT DICOM Modalities The list of the known DICOM modalities AETitle URL >
